Om Birla.description: NEW DELHI: The new Lok Sabha Speaker, Om Birla, a two-time BJP MP from Rajasthan, is a relative newcomer for the post traditionally held by seniors.   A surprise pick by the ruling BJP-led NDA   , Birla's name was proposed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi himself for the post, sources said. The 56-year-old leader is considered to be close to both Modi and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) president Amit Shah. Birla's nomination for the Lok Sabha Speaker's post also has the   backing of non-NDA parties   such as the YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) and the Biju Janata Dal (BJD). Starting his political journey as a student leader, Birla was also elected to the Rajasthan Assembly for three consecutive terms in 2003, 2008 and 2013. He won his first Lok Sabha election in 2014 and was again elected this year from Rajasthan's Kota-Bundi seat. Birla defeated Congress's Ramnarayan Meena with a margin of over 2.5 lakh votes in the recently-concluded general election. A conscientious parliamentarian, Birla has registered an 86-per cent average attendance in the House, asked 671 questions, participated in 163 debates and introduced six private members' bills in the 16th Lok Sabha. From 1991 to 2003, he was a key leader in the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) as a state-level president first and then, as a vice-president at the national level. Birla, who holds a Masters degree in commerce, is a member of the Standing Committee on Energy in Parliament, the Committee on Petitions and the Consultative Committee for the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment. He succeeds eight-time MP Sumitra Mahajan as the Lok Sabha Speaker, a post traditionally held by senior MPs. However, this is not the first time that a relative newcomer has occupied the position. In 1996, Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader G M C Balayogi, also a two-time MP then, was elected as the Speaker in the Lower House of Parliament. After his death in a helicopter crash in 2002, Shiv Sena leader and first-time MP Manohar Joshi was appointed to the position. Maharashtra CET cell blunder: SSC and HS.description: NAGPUR: Software blunders in the online admission portal being handled by the state CET cell for professional undergraduate courses led to major chaos among parents and last minute salvage operation by the authorities. One of the biggest bloopers was the interchanging of SSC and HSC marks column in the portal which meant science stream students could not enter correct information. The problems were rectified later in the evening. A parent, who did not wish to be identified, said, “In the HSC marks column, they asked us to enter marks for both maths and biology. Since both fields were mandatory, we were not able to proceed further. It is obvious that students who appear for maths in HSC will not be going for biology.” Another problem was faced while entering SSC marks because of a clause mentioned there. “On the screen, it was written that if you have not appeared for maths, science or english, then enter zero. But that is not possible since maths and science are compulsory subjects at SSC level. The only explanation is that the software is erroneously showing SSC fields on HSC page and vice versa,” the parent said. Students also had problems entering their NEET marks. One of the students said, “Entering the NEET scores basically allows me to be eligible for the 15% all India quota. But the portal was asking for marks scored in individual subjects, even though NEET authorities have only given us percentile. So, we are stuck and not able to proceed further.” A student who had been trying to apply for engineering colleges said that it had become difficult to get doubts clarified as well. “You try calling on their helplines and see how many times somebody actually picks up. It’s frustrating that they can’t do anything without creating a mess,” said the student. The CET cell authorities were well aware of the issues that their software is facing and had gone into the crisis-solving mode. Anand Rayate, head of the state CET cell, told TOI that all these issues were being discussed in his ‘war room’. “We are working on the problems and the HSC/SSC page issue will be sorted very soon. Every other hitch that is being noticed will also be rectified so that students do not suffer,” said Rayate. Many academicians said that the state CET cell is not able to handle the workload well. A senior academician said, “This is the first time that they are handling the entire process and probably were not ready to take up such a large scale assignment. The earlier authority, DTE, had been doing it for quite some time and had learnt from past errors and had a well-oiled machine in place. But not to be unfair to the CET cell, I believe these are just teething troubles.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Patients miss appointments, but show sol.description: NAGPUR: The one-day strike by private doctors in the city created problems for those patients who had sought prior appointments for regular check-ups and treatment. Unaware about the strike, patients reached clinics as per their scheduled time only to be told by the on-duty staff that doctors will not be available for the day. “I thought only corporate hospitals are on strike and not the smaller clinics. So, I came for my regular check-up. The clinic was open but I was told that non-essential services have been withdrawn for a day. I was given an appointment for tomorrow morning,” said Prakash Kulkarni, a senior citizen from Narendra Nagar. There are many hospitals in Dhantoli where patients come from different places with prior appointments months in advance. Many of these hospitals claimed that they informed patients about the strike and rescheduled their appointments. Many corporate hospitals also made it a point to check and treat patients coming from rural areas and other states to avoid inconvenience. “In fact, we admitted 17 patients today. We conducted three surgeries on trauma patients who came all the way from Betul and Chandrapur,” said Dr Sameer Paltewar of Meditrina hospital. “The OPD was closed. Not a single patient was checked. In fact, patients, too, cooperated,” he added. Non-availability of diagnostic services was a major problem for patients. Staff and technicians were available at CT scan centres and pathology labs. In many cases, they took blood samples and conducted scans but they refused to give reports before Tuesday if it was not an emergency. “Reports of several diagnostic scans and blood tests were provided instantly. We were asked to come tomorrow if it was not a case of emergency,” said Sushila Bhagat, a patient. Most of the patients expressed their solidarity with the doctors. “They are life givers and nobody has the right to attack them. How can we lose a trained doctor who can save hundreds of lives in a mob fury? There should be a central law with provisions of strict punishment in case of violence against doctors,” said Dr Dilip Dabir, a retired professor. Activist alleges Metro favoured L&T, age.description: Nagpur: Jai Jawan Jai Kisan leader Prashant Pawar on Wednesday alleged that MahaMetro had favoured L & T, which runs Hyderabad Metro, in leasing coaches. MahaMetro however, trashed his claim citing directives of Commissioner of Metro Rail Safety (CMRS). Citing a preliminary audit report, Pawar said that MahaMetro had leased six coaches from L & T for Rs15 crore a year. “Moreover, the coaches were leased for four years when they were required only for one year,” he added. MahaMetro managing director Brijesh Dixit said that the coaches have been leased for three years and not four. “After using them in Nagpur, we will take them to Pune and later may be Thane if state government awards the project to us. It takes weeks for new coaches to be tested and so the ones leased were vital for the trial run and inspections of Research Design and Standards Organization (RDSO) and Commissioner of Metro Rail Safety (CMRS),” he added. “We had earlier contacted Chennai Metro, a government owned one, for two trains. However, they are four coach trains and our platforms are not that long. Secondly, they have side evacuation facility against front evacuation of our coaches. CMRS asked us to lease only those trains that are similar to ours,” he further said. The cost of a Nagpur Metro train is around Rs30 crore, including taxes. However, L & T has charged Rs7.5 crore per train per year. On this, he said, “Even Chennai Metro had asked for Rs7.10 crore per train. The rent is on the higher side but it's a suppliers’ market. We didn’t contact other Metros after CMRS directive,” said Dixit. Pawar also alleged that there was a delay in delivery of coaches from China. Dixit countered it saying Nagpur Metro was the fastest in ordering the rolling stock. “There was a delay of about four months in finalizing the contract as one of the bidders had approached High Court and then Supreme Court,” he said. The MD further said that cost of rolling stock as per the detailed project report (DPR) was Rs922 crore while Nagpur Metro had awarded the tender for Rs718 crore thus leading to a saving of Rs204 crore. Jai Jawan Jai Kisan had earlier alleged that the contractor for Reach III had been awarded the contract for building some stations of Reach II without any tender. Dixit said that the DPR nowhere mentioned that construction work had to be awarded to different contractors. “Our contract for Reach III clearly states that work site means the places where the permanent works are to be executed and any other places as may be specified in the contract as forming part of the site. Our site in the entire city of Nagpur,” he added. Pawar also slammed MahaMetro for holding joyrides saying that there was no provision for it in the DPR. Dixit said that they were held on the request of citizens, who had endured a lot of inconvenience during construction work. “The coaches from L & T were leased for trial run and not joyrides,” he added. CMRS inspects Nagpur MetroA team of Commissioner of Metro Rail Safety (CMRS) led by commissioner Janak Kumar Garg took stock of various works being done by Nagpur Metro in Reach I (Sitabuldi to Khapri). KL Purthi and Varun Maurya were other members of the team. CMRS is here to sanction the second line of Reach I. Garg first met MahaMetro managing director Brijesh Dixit to learn about the progress of Reach I. He then held meetings with senior officials, including Mahesh Kumar, Sunil Mathur, S Sivamathan, Anil Kokate and others. The commissioner then visited Sitabuldi interchange station. He inspected the security system and various facilities available at the station. They included smoke detection system, emergency lighting, fire safety equipment, scanner, automatic fare collection gates, escalators, etc CMRS team will travel by trolley from Sitabuldi to Khapri and inspect Airport and Khapri stations on the way. Morning services in Metro will be closed on Thursday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Panel may propose to turn Aapli Bus flee.description: NAGPUR: BJP corporator and transport committee chairman Bunty Kukde will present NMC’s transport department’s budget before the standing committee meeting on Tuesday and he may propose to convert all diesel run Aapli Bus into CNG. Kukde will revise the budget of transport manager Shivajirao Jagtap who had presented the department’s budget in March this year by projecting a revenue of Rs281.99 crore in the new financial year while the expenditure had been pegged at 281.86 crore. During 2018-2019, the NMC had suffered a loss of Rs94.17 crore for operating Aapli Bus and generated revenue of Rs60.56 crore from the sale of tickets while the total expenditure in 2018-19 was Rs154.73 crore. Kukde will make some changes and he may propose to convert all NMC run-Aapli Bus through three red bus operators into CNG and electric. The tax department will also submit proposals to transfer ownership titles of 14 property owners who had become defaulters. The accounts and finance department will submit a proposal for the panel’s nod for annual accounts for the year 2016-17 and 2017-18. To combat manpower crunch, the fire and emergency services department has submitted a proposal to appoint three retired drivers and 14 retired firemen on contract basis for 11 months. Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Five girls, one woman die after private.description: NAGPUR: Five girls and a 45-year-old woman died after the private taxi in which they were travelling plunged into Chulbandh river from a bridge in Bhandara district on Tuesday. Another three were seriously injured in the accident. The taxi was heading towards Lakhandur from Sakoli when one of it’s tyre burst. The vehicle, which was apparently driven at top speed, veered towards the bridge railing and broke through it to crash down. The vehicle, which had 15 passengers, fell 50 feet, leaving it heavily damaged. A 12-year-old girl, Sheetal Raut, and Sharda Gotaphode, 45, were among those killed in the accident. A student among the dead was heading to take admission in a college. Three seriously injured were rushed to Bhandara district hospital, while others were taken to sub-district hospital at Sakoli. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. \u2018India has just 2.4% of world\u2019.description: NAGPUR: India holds only 2.4% of total land surface but we host more than 18% of the world population. So think how little we have and how much more we have to share among each other, revealed DS Meshram, president of Institute of Town Planners of India (ITPI), New Delhi, here on Monday. Dr Meshram was speaking during the second edition of lecture series on ‘Manageable Cities and it’s Determinant Factors’. The event was held by ITPI, at its hall in Trimurti Nagar, on Monday. Dr Meshram further said, “In India the land to per person ratio is 0.0024 while in the world it is 0.011.” “The main issues for the marginality disturbance are land, human and financial capital. There is no land in urban areas to develop, neither people have the finances to support anymore development,” he said. He gave an example saying, “A frog cannot grow up to the size of an elephant neither an elephant can grow to infinity, in the same way there is a limit to the expansion of cities and towns.” Main speaker of the event and director of School of Planning and Architecture, Bhopal, N Sridharan spoke about the importance of planning and people marginalized based on income, caste, space, gender, age and asset. He told about how Modi government focused on most deprived sections and has transformed lives and livelihoods. Sridharan sounded optimistic by saying that by 2031 the population would go down by 6,000 in South India. He concluded his speech by saying, “We need more planners today, than ever before.” Sujit Rodge, chairman of ITPI, Nagpur, and Sarika Bhadure were also present. (Reporting by Himesh Pande) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nStudents of ETC department of Yeshwant.description: It was time for the final year students of ETC department, Yeshwantrao Chavan College of Engineering, to bid goodbye to their college life. The farewell bash, which was organised recently on the college premises, was full of fun and nostalgia. Partying with their friends one last time, youngsters experienced a gamut of emotions. While outstation students were sad to leave the city, many seemed excited to join the companies they have been placed in through campus recruitment. Girls and boys didn’t forget to click numerous selfies and group snaps, which were instantly updated on their social media accounts. To add some more fun to the bash, various games were organised wherein seniors and juniors enthusiastically participated. Later, a leg-pulling session not only evoked plenty of laughter, but also proved to be a catalyst in making the bond stronger between the juniors and seniors. GMCs at Amravati, Buldhana get in-princi.description: NAGPUR: Crunch in MBBS seats will ease to some extent as the central government has given in-principle approval to seven new Government Medical Colleges in state. These include two in Vidarbha at Amravati and Buldhana. Medical education minister of Maharashtra Girish Mahajan told TOI Ministry of health and family welfare had given an in-principle approval to state government’s proposal to upgrade seven district hospitals in state into medical colleges. “I had a very fruitful meeting with Union health minister Dr Harsh Vardhan last week. He has sanctioned many proposals given by the state’s health education department. These include seven GMCs and several research institutes. This will bring in 3,670 more MBBS seats and nearly 800 PG seats in the state in the long run,” Mahajan said. The central government’s health ministry has a scheme to establish new medical colleges by upgrading district or referral hospitals. As part of this, it has been proposed to convert 75 district hospitals into medical colleges to boost availability of human resource for health sector. Maharashtra has proactively submitted proposals for seven district hospitals. When these hospitals become medical colleges, the directorate of medical education (DMER) will run them instead of directorate of health services (DHS). This is still a first step. It takes time to establish a medical college even if a general hospital has many basic facilities. According to a senior official of DMER, the state as well as the Centre were keen to increase MBBS and MD seats as it was necessary for the implementation of EWS reservation. “The in-principle approval is a major step. These seven new GMCs will be functional in next two years,” the official claimed. At present, there are 41 medical colleges in State. They are affiliated to Maharashtra University of Health Sciences (MUHS). In Vidarbha, there are two GMCs in Nagpur, and one each in Chandrapur, Yavatmal, Akola, and Gondia. Major boost to medical education New medical colleges: District hospitals in seven districts — Buldhana, Amravati, Satara, Parbhani, Nandurbar, Nashik and Sindhudurg will become medical colleges Long pending Institutes: Pending work of Regional Institute of Paramedical Science in Nagpur, Special paramedical centres in Pune and Miraj will be completed Research organization: Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH) in Nagpur will have a centre of excellence in Sickle Cells Hemoglobinopathy developed by ICMR Cancer care: As projects like National Cancer Grid, Virtual Tumour Board, Cancer Fellowship are to be implemented in state, a national cancer institute will be started in Jalgaon More MBBS Seats: Total 3,670 seats will be added to state’s quota. From these, 2020 could be used for implementation of EWS reservation and 1650 for implementation Maratha reservation Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. SEBC ordinance: SC seeks state response.description: Nagpur: A division bench of the Supreme Court comprising justices Deepak Gupta and Surya Kant on Wednesday directed the Maharashtra government to file a reply by Monday on the special leave petition (SLP) filed by aggrieved post graduate medical students. After the Nagpur bench of Bombay High Court rejected their plea, students from the city have once again knocked the Supreme Court’s doors for justice. On June 13, the HC bench consisting of justices Sunil Shukre and Shreeram Modak rejected the petition filed by Dr Sagar Sarda, Dr Sameer Deshmukh and other PG aspirants challenging Maharashtra government’s ordinance for 16% seats under SEBC quota for Maratha students. The Maharashtra State Reservation (of seats for admission in educational institutions in the State and for appointments in the public services and posts under the State) for Socially and Educationally Backward Classes (Amendment and Validation) Ordinance, 2019, was promulgated to supersede HC’s and SC’s verdicts that had quashed the SEBC quota for PG medical seats in state. Senior counsels Shekhar Naphade and Meenakshi Arora, assisted by Hrishikesh Chitale and Ashwin Deshpande pleaded for the petitioners. They contended that the HC refused to hear their plea due to SC’s orders or June 4 where it had prohibited all courts from hearing any case related to this vexed issue. They pointed out that SEBC Act, which was actually implemented from November 30, was also under challenge in HC’s principal bench in Mumbai. The SC judges clarified that it can’t just leave the petitioners “remedy-less” as either HC or SC had to adjudicate the issue. They pointed out that SC itself had directed the petitioners to approach the Nagpur bench for relief. In their plea, the PG aspirants pointed out that HC had refused to entertain their contentions citing top court’s orders of June 4 and 10. They argued that the SEBC ordinance was contrary to the law set by the SC and prayed for its quashing. According to them, the ordinance is clearly an attempt to nullify the HC’s May 2 judgement that was later upheld by the SC. It’s also an effort to circumvent the apex court’s directives that amounts to interfering with its order. They were been prejudiced by the ordinance of illegally applying reservation and thus depriving them of benefit of the HC and SC orders. The ordinance is thus contrary to the law laid down by SC and deserves to be set aside. Both Sarda and Deshmukh had filed first petition in the Nagpur bench where they had challenged 16% SEBC quota in the PG medical seats, which was quashed by the bench comprising justices Sunil Shukre and Pushpa Ganediwala on May 2. While clarifying that the SEBC quota would be made applicable from the next academic year only, the HC had declared provisional PG seats matrix of March 27 that had a provision for SEBC candidates as “illegal”. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Navegaon-Nagzira staff gets lessons in w.description: Nagpur: A two-day training workshop on ‘wildlife investigation through forensic techniques’ was organized for Navegaon-Nagzira Tiger Reserve (NNTR) and buffer zone field staff recently. During the past two years there have been several wild animal and bird deaths under mysterious conditions in the buffer zone of NNTR in Gondia district. These deaths continued during this summer season too. “In some cases, samples were collected and sent for forensic and pathological examinations to various labs but unfortunately in most of the cases results were inconclusive due to sample getting contaminated or being unfit due to various reasons. Our idea to give lessons to the staff and teach them about forensics,” said Anil Kumar, manager of Wildlife Trust of India (WTI), which organized the training. A study done by NGO Wild-CER revealed that in most cases samples are not collected properly, using right preservatives, labelling and transportation, which leads to flawed results. According to National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA), Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra collect highest number of samples for tiger deaths for forensic examination but Maharashtra has highest number of collected samples remaining inconclusive. To address the problem, both Wild-CER and WTI came together to fill the knowledge gap among front-line employees from NNTR and buffer zone of Gondia and Bhandara divisions. The training was given by experts like Dr AB Shrivastav, retired HoD, School of Wildlife Forensic & Health, Jabalpur; Dr Priya Baviskar, assistant professor with Nagpur Veterinary College; and Dr Bahar Baviskar, director, Wild-CER. It was attended by 122 front-line staff of NNTR and Gondia and Bhandara divisions. The training briefed on introduction to forensic study and its scope, collection, preservation of samples, various types of examinations to be done, right packing, labelling and delivery of the samples, scat collection and health monitoring. Demonstration of sample collection equipment was also given to the participants. NNTR field director & conservator M Ramanujam, deputy field director Poonam Pate, DFO Uttam Sawant extended support in organizing the training along with ACFs Pradeep Patil and Shrikant Pawar. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Vacant RTE seats: Second round admission.description: NAGPUR: Parents whose wards have been selected for school admissions under RTE quota in the second round have time till June 27 to complete the admission formalities. With almost 50% RTE seats in Nagpur district remaining vacant, authorities are hoping that all selected parents complete the admission process so that the gap can be bridged further. Out of the total 7,204 RTE seats in the district, only 3,714 could be filled. In the second round, 2,731 students have been offered seats for which the admission deadline is June 27. However, it is almost guaranteed that RTE seats will remain vacant in many schools as majority of the parents try for branded English medium schools. In fact, in Nagpur the applications received were more than 300% of the seats available. But many applications get rejected because of improper address being mentioned or documents not being in order. There have been many cases of parents ‘shifting’ their residence close to a well known school so that they become eligible for RTE under the distance criteria. In RTE, preference is given to students who reside closest to the school. But many issues related to mapping of address in the online application form also created multiple issues. NGO RTE Action Committee had filed official objections over the address mapping in the online software as many admissions had been rejected because of this. Following these issues, the education department formed a verification committee which comprised of its own officials plus other experts. This committee then scrutinizes applications that have been rejected and ensures that it has been done so only due to valid reasons. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Musical \u2018Voice of city\u2019 entert.description: Nagpur: To take the music lovers on a melodious journey, the karaoke singer club Prafulla Shah organized a programme ‘Voice of city’ at Utkarsh Hall, Mor Hindi Bhavan, Sitabuldi, on Tuesday. Conceptualized by the members of the group including Yogesh Butke, CY Raipure and Sandeep Malik, the show was hosted by Pravin Bhivgade.Most of the songs presented by the artistes were originally sung by legendary singers like Lata Mangeshkar, Mohammed Rafi, Asha Bhosle, Mukesh, Kavita Krishnamurthy and Kishore Kumar.Butke kick-started the event with the peppy number ‘Darde dil darde jigar’ from the movie ‘Karz’ which was followed by a duet performance by Vijaya and Sandeep Malik on ‘Teri yaad aa rahi hai’ from the movie ‘Love Story’. Vaibhav Dashputre mesmerized the audience with his performance on ‘Koi roko na dewaane ko’ from the movie ‘Priyatma’. The next performance by Chanchal Singh on ‘Dewaana mai chala’ which was well-received. The soulful composition ‘Lambi judai’ was rendered by Bhagyashree Kulkarni and went on to perform another duet with Singh on ‘Tip tip barsa paani’ that set the mood right.The artistes engaged the music lovers with evergreen songs like ‘Raat ke humsafar’, ‘Pyaar do pyaar lo’, ‘Sola baras ki baali umar’, ‘Ek pyaar ka nagma hai’, ‘Naino mein badra chhaye’ , ‘Tu tu hai wahi’, ‘Jo tumko ho pasand’ and some others makingthe audience jog down the memory lane.Other singers Aruna Choudhari, Shaila Kachore, Kaushik Pujari and Alpa Tawaliya entertained the gathering.(Reporting by Srishti Sankrit)Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rare albino Eurasian coot sighted at Gor.description: NAGPUR: A rare sighting of partial albino Eurasian Coot (Fulica atra) has been reported in Gorewada lake in the city by bird watchers. “Eurasian Coot is black in colour and has a white patch on the forehead but the sighted particular individual has white feathers and some black patches. This is the first such sighting of a partial albino bird in Vidarbha,” said ornithologist and founder of Central India Bird Academy (CIBA), Dr Anil Pimplapure. The bird was sighted by Dr Pimplapure, along with Kaustubh Pandharipande, Aniruddha Bhagat in Gorewada lake on Monday morning. The bird watchers stumbled upon the bird when they had gone to see the plight of the drying Gorewada lake. Dr Pimplapure recalled such a sighting was reported at Bhigwan near Pune previously and this case is extremely rare. This stage occurs due to lack of pigmentation named melanin in the birds due to which the feathers of the bird turn white. “Melanin gives strength to feathers and protects damage to eyes due to the ultra violet rays of the sun,” he added. Dr Pimplapure further said that the lake's water level has reached the lowest since last 100 years. The sighting of this bird has delighted the city birders. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. One more MRO expected to start in Mihan.description: Nagpur: The Mihan-SEZ may soon have one more aircraft maintenance repair and overhaul (MRO) depot operational. Indamer Aviation which has been allotted land next to the Air India’s MRO, has completed 70% of construction work with four hangars ready. It plans to start operations by December end this year. Indamer Aviation in which two Indian businessmen Prayaj Patel and Sunil Gupta have a stake has tied up with US aircraft maintenance services provider AAR. The MRO, spread in 30 acres of land in the SEZ, will be taking up framework maintenance of Airbus 320 aircraft. This means the outer body, interiors and work except major overhaul of the engines will be done here. Rajesh Gupta, the CEO of Indamer said his company hopes to get the FAA and EASA approvals from the American and European aviation authorities in the coming months. If secured in the expected time, Indamer Aviation’s set up in Mihan can be the first framework MRO to be operational in India. “This would be a win-win situation for the company, airlines and also the government as it would save a substantial foreign exchange outgo,” he said. “Airlines like Indigo and Go Air have already expressed their willingness to offer business to Indamer Aviation after the operations begin. This means the MRO hopes to have sizeable business in the initial stages itself,” he added. Indamer Aviation is also the oldest MRO in the country. It began in 1939 with a single hangar near the Juhu Airport. The company was then promoted by American entrepreneur Joseph Koszarek. In 2007, the company became part of European Aviation holding Company Private Limited (EAHC). Finally Patel and Gupta invested in the business. With the Nagpur venture, Indamer will be taking up works for the civil aviation aircraft for the first time. This means, so far it was taking up the servicing of private jets, and at Nagpur it would be catering to even aircraft deployed by various airlines, explained Gupta. Meanwhile in what may give another boost to the Mihan-SEZ, the Concor’s Inland Container Depot (ICD), is expected to start within a month’s time. All that needs to be done is that the ICD needs to be connected with the station by the railways. Concor is a subsidiary of Indian Railways that is engaged in transport of cargo containers to the seaports. Concor’s chief general manager for Central India Arunkumar Satpathy said the agency is in a position to start the facility in a month’s time if the rail connectivity is established. Under the present situation, trains running from the direction of Nagpur to Mumbai can reach the ICD but not those form the opposite direction. “There has been a time overrun as the work was expected to have been completed by 2016. However, now the railways have assured to finish it within a month’s time after which the ICD here can become operational,” said Sathpathy, adding, “Once ready, majority of the work from the present ICD at Narendra Nagar will be shifted to Mihan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

300% rise in applications for board answ.description: NAGPUR: The Nagpur and Amravati divisional boards saw an unprecedented rush of students applying for photocopies of their HSC and SSC answersheets, which was a result of speculations that the evaluation has been very ‘strict’. Nagpur office specifically saw a 300% increase in the number of applications received for photocopies, which is the first step before students can apply for revaluation. The last date for applying for a photocopy ended on Monday. In Nagpur, over 5,000 students applied for photocopies of HSC while over 1,000 applied for SSC. In Amravati, over 1,700 HSC students applied for photocopies while only 1,000 did so for SSC. A senior board official said, “This time the rush for applications at Nagpur was extremely high. It was definitely more than three times of what we witnessed last year.” TOI was the first to report about huge rush across the state for paper valuation as many science students saw their scores being extremely low in one of the core subjects. The Vidarbha Junior College Teachers Association had issued a statement at that time saying their members have not made any mistake in evaluation, and the marks are just a reflection of how students performed on a particular day. With every subject’s photocopy costing Rs400, the two boards in Vidarbha have raked in a minimum of Rs50 lakh in application fee. Madhusudhan Mude, president of Headmasters Association (HA) said the fee was too high and should have been brought down. “Majority of the students apply for at least two subjects, some even go for three. This means that the board offices could have earned more Rs1 crore also. I think there is no reason for such a high application fee to be charged as most of the students in state board are not very economically strong so there is absolutely need for the board to be charging such an high amount,” said Mude. State to give compensation to boy who su.description: WARDHA: The state government is moving to give compensation to the 8-year-old boy of Matang community, who suffered burns on being forced to sit on hot tiles as punishment after entering a temple at Arvi last week. Aryan Khadse (8), a resident of Rani Laxmibai Ward of Arvi town was accused of stealing some coins from the Jogna Mata temple in the same locality by accused Umesh alias Amol Dhore. The accused punished Aryan by forcing him to sit on hot tiles on Saturday afternoon, which caused serious burn injuries on his buttocks. NCP leader Ajit Pawar drew attention of the assembly to the episode, saying the incident is shameful and raises doubts about progressive Maharashtra. The government should do something strict to curb such incidents in future, he said. Wardha BJP MP Ramdas Tadas visited the civil hospital at Wardha, where the boy has been shifted for treatment. He said, “I spoke to the boy and he is still in fear about the incident. I consoled him and told his parents not to worry. I will personally look into the case and the accused will be not let free.” District collector Vivek Bhimanwar said, “We have arrested the accused and an inquiry is going on. The facts will come out after the inquiry. I just signed files to help the boy and his family economically for his treatment expenses.” Civil surgeon C Madavi said, “The boy is healing now, and he will be in hospital for a week. After his treatment ends, we will discharge him.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Uttar Pradesh.description: "You're sitting on my grand mother's grave," Salim Shah told this correspondent. She has been buried, he said, in his living room. A clutch of houses in Chah Pokhar in Achnera block of Agra have turned into graveyards as families are forced to bury their departed in their homes due to lack of a burial ground. As a result, the dead here are a constant part of day-to-day life. TOI found women cooking next to where their children were buried while the elderly rested on cots in a backyard full of graves. In one of the houses, Rinki Begum told TOI that five bodies were buried in her backyard, including that of her 10-month-old son who had died of an untreated fever. Another resident, Guddi, said, "For poor people like us, there is no dignity in death. Due to lack of space in houses, people have to sit and walk over graves. It is so disrespectful." Almost all the houses in the block have graves within the compound Most of the Muslim families here are poor and landless and men scout for work as contract labourers. They said their demand for a graveyard has been ignored for years. The pond in Chah Pokhar village, where a piece of land is allocated for the burial ground on papersThe apathy of the administration can be gauged from the fact that a plot allotted for a graveyard some years ago falls right in the middle of a pond. Repeated complaints have fallen on deaf ears and residents are running out of space. The fresh graves are no more cemented to ensure they occupy less space and stones of different sizes kept over them are the only way to tell them apart. Protests have erupted in the past over the issue. In 2017, after the death of resident Mangal Khan, his family refused to bury his body until land for a graveyard was provided in the village. After assurances by the authorities, they buried Khan near the pond. But the promises came to nothing. Living with the dead: A grave in the backyard"All we are asking for is some land for our ancestors. There is a cremation ground for the Hindus in the periphery of the village, but we are living with our dead," said Munim Khan, a factory worker. Desperate residents even tried reaching out to nearby Sanan village and Achnera town that have burial grounds. But they were not willing to part with precious space. "These two villages have a larger Muslim population than Chah Pokhar. Their burial grounds are filled to capacity," said Nizam Khan, a mechanic. Village pradhan Sundar Kumar said that he had asked officials several times for a burial ground for Muslim families, but no action was taken. Ravi Kumar NG, the district magistrate, said that he was not aware of the issue. "I will send an official team to the village and get details of the burial land required." Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Godown owner steals tenant\u2019s items.description: NAGPUR: Kalamna police on Tuesday registered a case burglary and trespassing against the owner of a godown for allegedly stealing items worth Rs 17 lakh from the godown. The accused, Rajendra Zade, 51, was having a dispute over vacating the godown with his tenant Ramesh Bhat, 54, over which he took the step. Police said Zade had give the godown on rent to Bhat a few years back. But recently the duo was having a dispute over the godown. Zade, a resident of Chhapru Nagar Chowk, along with his accomplices, broke open the lock and allegedly stole items worth Rs17 lakh from the godown. When the incident came to light, Bhat approached Kalamna police and filed a complaint. Kalamna police have registered a case of burglary, theft and trespassing against Zade and his accomplices. Police are yet to make any arrests in the matter. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Sighted: \u2018Rare\u2019 Black Capped K.description: NAGPUR: Sighting of Black Capped Kingfisher at Tadoba Lake has given bird enthusiasts a reason to smile, as it is not often that this species is spotted. On June 10, Amit Dixit, along with his friends and family, was on his regular wildlife safari at Tadoba when they sighted this species. Dixit, who was accompanied by his friend Amit Maywad, chanced upon this bird in the morning and immediately knew it was special. “I heard the bird call and that got my attention. It was there sitting on a branch and the colours struck me as something different. I knew it was a Kingfisher, but I was not sure which type. I zoomed in with my camera and took multiple photos of it,” said Dixit, whose wife Shweta, daughter Rucha and even mother Vaijayanti are bird enthusiasts. Once back home, Dixit scoured the internet to find out which species it exactly was. “Then, I found out that it was the Black Capped Kingfisher and other senior bird enthusiasts that I spoke to said others must be made aware of it,” said Dixit. Black Capped Kingfisher resides mainly in coasts of India and Bangladesh. It has a black cap, white collar, deep purplish-blue upper parts, black coverts contrasting with blue secondaries. In flight, it shows bright blue rump & prominent white patches at base of primaries. Raju Kasambe, an avid bird researcher and assistant director of Education and Conservation Education Centre at Bombay Natural History Society, said that the bird is seen usually in this area. “I would not exactly call it rare because people have seen it regularly. The Black Headed Kingfisher is a different species and is found in Sumatra,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra yet to assess damage.description: NAGPUR: The state government has taken no cognisance of the loss in oranges despite being aware of the situation. A group of leaders led by former MLA Ashish Deshmukh had met district collector Ashwin Mudgal more than a fortnight back and appraised him about the dwindling water scenario in orange orchards. In their representation, they had demanded 90% subsidy on drip irrigation, supply of water through tankers in highly dried areas for irrigation and advising state agriculture farmers to guide in mulching. “The collector had assured us to forward our demands to the chief minister. Unlike western Maharashtra, Vidarbha’s horticulture farmers have got no compensation for drought in areas like Kalmeshwar, Katol and Narkhed,” said Deshmukh. The state agriculture department has also not conducted any survey yet to assess the extent of the orchard drying. R Bhonsale, joint director agriculture, Nagpur division, told TOI that the survey can be done only on directions of the district collector. “We have no such instructions yet,” he said. New state agriculture minister Anil Bonde said that he took meetings of agriculture secretaries and directors, and told them to generate their own data on affected areas without depending on the revenue department. “Agriculture department officials should remain connected with farmers and always have an estimate of any losses about all crops,” he said. Though most farmers are claiming that their orchards incurred permanent damage, MS Ladaniya, the director Central Citrus Research Institute (CCRI), has denied it. “It is temporary drying. Even if a few green leaves are present on a tree, it can be revived through rain. But this is possible only in the areas where there is heavy and deep soil in orange growing areas in Morshi, Warud and Katol tehsils. Oranges in shallow and light soils will not survive such drought,” he said. Ladaniya claims that CCRI had issued advisories to orange growers to thin the fruits (remove half fruits) from trees to reduce the loss on a tree. The institute had also suggested mulching (covering of the tree bottom by grass, straw or even plastic) to prevent evaporation losses. This helps conserve water near the roots. “The state government needs to take the issue seriously. Farmers should be advised to retain moisture in soil and spend more money on it. Last monsoon had a 23% deficit. If this persists, this year too the situation will be grave. There should be a water grid for proper distribution. It is an expensive proposition but is one of the solutions,” said Ladaniya. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nTheatre connoisseurs enjoy the thrills.description: Enid Blyton’s classic English story— Five on a Treasure Island — from the famous five series was recently staged as a play in the city and it received great response from the theatre lovers. The play was directed by Vikash Khurana and had many thrilling and adventurous moments coupled with timely humour to keep the audience’s interest levels intact till the end. The young actors delighted the discerning audience with their performances and Khurana’s role as an antagonist was also appreciated by everyone. When we asked the director whether he had any inhibitions prior to the staging of the play, he said, “My biggest concern was to incorporate various scenes from the play on a small stage, but with proper planning, we managed to transcend the audience to Kirrin Island and the English countryside where the story is set.” We saw educationist Dr Dipti Christian and theatre person Aditya Bansod enjoying the theatrical treat with their friends.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nHeart-wrenching tale enthralled Nagpur.description: A Marathi play Vyakti aani Valli was recently staged at Dr Vasantrao Deshpande Hall. Nagpur’s theatre buffs enjoyed a mélange of various characters and their eccentricities. Theatrical adaption of a book penned by legendary litterateur P L Deshpande, the rib-tickling play — directed by Chandrakant Kulkarni — had popular names from Marathi film and theatre world in the star cast. Actor-director Mahesh Manjrekar, Sunil Barve, Bhau Kadam, Anand Ingale etc. swept the audience off their feet with their impeccable comic timing and strong dialogue delivery. Needless to say, the auditorium reverberated with loud applause when the show ended. Gotya Sawant also garnered praises as a sutradhar. Former Union cabinet minister, Vilas Muttemwar with wife Chhaya, former Maha ministers Anil Deshmukh and Ranjit Deshmukh with wife Rupa enjoyed the play. Divisional Commissioner Anoop Kumar and IPS officers Deepali Masirkar and Rohan Samant were also spotted. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. We spotted principal of the college Vinod Mankar and educationists Subhash Babhulkar, Vikash Joshi, Rakesh Pathrabe and Rajendra Giri having a good time at the fiesta.
