A blend of medical studies and engineeri.description: Practice makes a man perfect. This phrase has motivated almost every successful person till date. Stepping into any field requires a notion of ability regarding the interest invested, along with time and energy. No stream or study has ever been victoriously chased if it lacks choice or interest. Most students in this generation opt for science after their class X, but fail to choose between engineering and medical, as they have a share of interest in both the fields. For such students, pharmacy is the right choice. Pharmacy is a blend of medical studies and engineering minds. This subject can help one find the right direction towards a career path. Pharmacy has a huge scope in the business sector. For the past few years, production, supply and demand for medicines has only increased. The requirement does not seem to have a stop either. For all those who are interested in entrepreneurship, pharmacy is a great option. Nayan Bajaj, a medical store owner and a businessman, said, “There is an undying scope in pharmacy studies. The developments and new technologies have only taken this field to a higher level. A diploma course in pharmacy is mandatory for those who rely in the field of business itself. For higher studies, bachelor’s and master’s degrees are compulsorily required.” “Doctors and medicines are soul partners who are interconnected and cannot really function without each other. Pharmacy, in this way, soars as one of the best professions,” he added. Advancements in every field has reached heights in this era, whereas researches seem never to end. Every day, a new technology is discovered. Even in pharmacy, clinical research is a great choice. Neha Kriplani, a clinical research associate, said, “The profession is helpful and effective for as long as there is requirement for medicines. There is a huge scope in this field as almost everyone today is a consumer and scientists are keen producers.” “Different companies and departments offer high-paying job to degree holders. Clinical research deals with testing and producing of medicines, and this field is widely resourceful. Pharmacy gives an opportunity to understand both a patient’s life as well as a doctor’s work,” she said. Mohit Wadhwani, a pharmacist, said, “The number of patients is increasing day by day. This has led to a drastic increase in production of medicines. The profession is highly standardized for those students who have an equal interest in biology and mathematics. This field gives a chance to figure out a marketeer’s life completely. There is a great scope and this field is one such section where knowledge of almost every subject and practical life is streamed.” XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX Why opt for the subject Desire for flexibility in career choice Unique approach to healthcare Benefit from the demand of pharmacists Work with state-of-the-art technology XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX Expert View Dr Abhay Ittadwar Career scope, job opportunities huge Once a child is admitted to a school, there are no other options but to continue the studies without few alterations till Std X. So, after passing SSC, the natural question is ‘what next?’ Here, one has to be selective to opt for one of the streams among science, commerce and arts, while another choice is polytechnic, depending upon the passion and eligibility. Once the science stream is opted for, there are further choices like physics, chemistry & biology i.e. PCB group or physics, chemistry & mathematics i.e. PCM group or both mathematics and biology group. The current trend, which has likely become common these days, is medical sciences or engineering. For those who do not fulfill the merit list demands, and have opted for PCM or PCB or PCMB, pharmacy is the right choice to step in. Pharmacy offers a variety of subjects along with diploma and degree courses. Pharmaceutical companies have a suitable amount of share in the market. Hence, it is one of the leading occupations with a business choice. One can opt pharmacy for a career in production, research, quality assurance, regulation affairs, patents, corporates, academics, hospitals, entrepreneurship and so on. Recent trend and technologies like artificial intelligent, 3D printing, biotechnology, nanotechnology etc has further increased the scope. Career scope and job opportunities in pharmacy are huge. Due to opening of large pharmaceutical companies and government policies like startup, Make in India, generic medicines etc, the future in this field is bright. Numerous jobs are available for pharmacists in government as well as private organizations. After completing studies, one can easily find jobs in pharmaceutical industries, government departments, universities, hospitals, investigation and research institutes etc or can opt for entrepreneurship. (Dr Ittadwar is the principal of Guru Nanak College of Pharmacy, Nagpur) XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX List of colleges Guru Nanak College of Pharmacy Course offered: B.Pharm, M.Pharm (pharmaceutics), M.Pharm (pharmaceutical chemistry), M.Pharm (quality assurance), PhD (Pharma) Duration: 4 years for B.Pharm, 2 years for all master’s, 5 years for PhD Admission procedure: Maharashtra Common Entrance Test and Common Admission Process Source: College website Department of Pharmaceutical Sciences, Nagpur University Course offered: B.Pharm, M.Pharm (pharmaceutics), M.Pharm (pharmaceutical chemistry), PhD (Pharma) Duration: 4 years for B.Pharm, 2 years for all master’s, 5 years for PhD Procedure: MH-CET Common Admission Process Source: College website Dadasaheb Balpande College of Pharmacy, Nagpur Courses offered: B.Pharm, M.Pharm (pharmaceutics), PhD (pharma) Duration: 4 years for B.Pharm, 2 years for all master’s, 5 years for PhD Procedure: MH-CET and Common Admission Process Source: College website Kamla Nehru College of Pharmacy Courses Offered: B.Pharm, M.Pharm Duration: 4 years for B.Pharm, 2 years for master’s Procedure: MH-CET and Common Admission Process Source: College website This list is not exhaustive and should not be considered as the endorsement of the institute. Students are advised to check with relevant education authorities before taking admission XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX PROFESSIONALS SPEAK Pharmacy in itself is a science. It takes a lot of technique and expertise to prepare medicinal drugs and review it. People take it lightly what a pharmacist does but it really is a big deal. A bright and prosperous career can be made in it. Every medical student should consider it as a career option Mayank Deo Singh Being a pharmacist for a while now, I can proudly say that I love my job and would recommend it to everyone who is interested in it. Pharmacy is an art and is as important as any other profession. It takes a lot of studying to reach where I have reached and it is always worth it Akrosh Chaturvedi The industry of pharmaceuticals is big and is expected to grow more. It is a very beneficial industry and is also welcoming. Students do not have to study as much as they have to in medical, but it is equally rewarding and important. It is funny how people undermine pharmacy Sanjay Singh It is a very rewarding and prosperous field. All the aspirants who would like to join it should remember that you should never be a pharmacist if you do not have a licence. It is very dangerous. To ensure the safety of public, it is important that you do not play with anyone’s life Pawan Kumar Mishra Coming from a medical background, I always saw myself doing something in the same field. I am extremely lucky to have gotten the opportunity to pursue my career in pharmacy. It always intrigued me how a pharmacist always knew the exact drug to cure the problem Pradeep Singh Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

NMC notice to Scania for shifting buses.description: NAGPUR: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) city transport department on Tuesday served notice to Swedish bus maker Scania Commercial Vehicles India Private Ltd for moving out its ethanol-run buses from the city without any intimation. The civic body also questioned how Scania dismantled the ethanol fuel dispensing unit at Khapri. TOI had, on Tuesday, reported Scania had shifted 24 of the 25 ethanol buses, probably to Bengaluru, putting paid to NMC’s plan to resume the country’s first green city bus service. Chairman of city transport committee Bunty Kukde conducted an investigation and found only one bus was left in the city. Following Kukde’s directives, city transport manager Shivaji Jagtap sent notice to Torbjorn Glad, CEO of Scania’s special purpose vehicle — SST Sustainable Transport Solutions. “It is a very serious issue that you unilaterally shifted buses from the city. The buses were registered with RTO as public transport vehicles. Therefore, the permission of appropriate authority was mandatory, which was not ensured. Therefore, we will take appropriate action against you after verifying legal provisions,” Jagtap said. Kukde said NMC will inform arbitrator AR Patil about the incident. “Scania had stopped the service unilaterally. NMC had refused to accept termination notice of Scania. It seems the company was not interested in serving the city, local people and country. We will take appropriate action, as we have Scania’s bank guarantee and payment,” he said. \nCultural fest organised at Chitnavis C.description: Nagpurians enjoyed an amazing collaboration of musical theatre along with a fusion of vocal and instrumental recitals at a cultural fest organised at Chitnavis Centre recently. The superlative performances, gripping storyline, peppy songs and a strong message of the play impressed the ardent theatre lovers of the city. Vijay Mohod stabbed to death in running.description: NAGPUR: The two alleged assailants, Abhay Raut and Suraj Karlawar, were arrested by crime branch on Monday for murdering gangster Vijay Mohod on Sunday. The accused allegedly told the crime branch that the victim was stabbed to death inside a moving car. The two, produced before the court on Tuesday, were remanded to police custody for five days. Police said the car in which Mohod was stabbed to death would be seized soon. The crime branch is now set to arrest Tidke. Investigating officer API Kiran Choughule of crime branch had sought 10 days remand custody for Raut and Karlawar. Mohod, having two murders and other offences against him including kidnapping of gangster Maroti Nuwah, was killed over operating gambling dens. He operated a gambling den at Dhamna and was opposing a new one at Kharsoli run by Raut, who now has three murder cases against him. Mohod wanted partnership in the gambling den at Kharsoli, which Raut wanted to expand. Mohod was taken to Kharsoli in a car by Raut, Karlawar and Nitin Tidke to see a place where the den could start soon. Karlawar was behind the wheels while Raut was seated beside him. Tidke, with whom Mohod had a fight at a bar at Butibori, was seated beside the driver. A heated exchange between Mohod and Raut suddenly led to the assault. Raut and Tidke repeatedly stabbed Mohod until he collapsed in the car, which is owned by a person identified as Vaid. Mohod’s body was dumped near Vela Hari village and the assailants sped away. DCP, crime, Nilesh Bharne said there may be bigger action awaiting the gang which is behind the murder. “We are contemplating various legal issues to book the assailants,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Experts brainstorm over clean air issue.description: NAGPUR: A seminar titled ‘Clearing the air in Nagpur: Strengthening actions through partnerships’, jointly organized by Clean Air Asia (CAA), Nagpur Municipal Corporation and Integrated Programme for Better Air Quality in Asia (IBAQ) provided a platform for a discussion on the Nagpur air action plan which has been recently approved by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).  The clean air action plan was prepared by Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) with support from National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (Neeri) and the NMC has taken up the lead in its implementation. The seminar was inaugurated by mayor Nanda Jichkar and municipal commissioner Abhijit Bangar. Setting the context for the seminar, India director of CAA Prarthana Borah said, “Since the clean air action plan has been approved by the CPCB, it is now time to deliberate over its implementation. The major problem lies in developing cities as there is increased constructional dust and emissions due to improper waste management deteriorate the air quality.” Borah said that the objective of organizing the session was to engage in a discussion regarding sustainable urban development and clean technology for clean air. Bangar emphasized on the need to take account of the vulnerable sections of the city as all localities are not affected equally. He added, “It is high time to start implementation of schemes for the improvement in air quality management. Through this event, an organized effort will be made to retain Nagpur's ‘Green city’ tag and move forward in the direction of maintaining good air quality for future generations.” In her address, Jichkar focused on the regulatory, policy and implementation tactics. She said, “Now that the Smart City project is in full-swing, the hazardous dust particles from constructional activities is a matter of seriousness. I hope, through citizen awareness and government partnership, we derive a concrete solution to mitigate pollution. Neeri has done a great job at creating a road map of the activities that need to be done. With the help of concerned officials and participation of leaders, we will implement strict rules to ensure everyone breathes fresh air.” Leena Buddhe, director at Centre for Sustainable Development (CFSD), urged NGOs to collaborate in implementation of the air action plan for leveraging wider change. AS Harinath, from World Bank, delved deeper into the aspects of implementation strategy of Nagpur air action plan. He said, “Having an action plan is the first step. Our commitment is to build on the government’s action plan. We then need implementation, investment and coordination between a number of agencies.” Representatives from local government, civil society, academia and technology providers engaged in an interactive session where they analysed their roles in the action plan and suggested proposals. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Read this story in MarathiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Vikas Mahatme feels allocation of Rs 100.description: NAGPUR: Rajya Sabha member Dr Vikas Mahatme, the ophthalmologist from the city who had emerged as the mass leader of Dhangars in 2013 during a BJP-backed agitation seeking reservation as scheduled tribes (ST) for the community, said the move to allocate Rs 1,000 crore in the state budget for the community will go a long way. Even as the demand for reservation will not be withdrawn earmarking of such an amount will certainly leave the community enthused. “The grudge that Dhangars have not been granted ST status will certainly not come in the way of the good news that as much as Rs1,000 crore has been sanctioned. This has set a precedent as never before a substantial amount was specifically sanctioned for the benefit of a single community,” Mahatme told TOI. Before the state elections, BJP had promised Dhangars, a community of shepherds who are now classified as nomadic tribes (NT), reservation as STs. The promise has remained unfulfilled. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that the government will send its recommendations to the centre on the basis of a report on Dhangars’ socio-economic status prepared by the Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS). Even as TISS has submitted its report in November 2018, it has not been tabled in the state assembly. However, Mahatme said not getting ST status may not affect Dhangars votes for the BJP. Dhangar leaders in NCP and Congress have called the allocation a mere eyewash. They said they would be taking up the issue with their respective party high commands demanding that a mass agitation should be launched. Mahatme’s own popularity had waned after he accepted the Rajya Sabha seat from BJP and the agitation lost steam. Mahatme said, “Reservation is affirmative action intended for the benefit of a certain class. Finally, if benefit is the aim, it can also come through measures announced in the budget.” he said. On the reservation issue, he said, “The BJP has at least declared a package but no other party is talking about reservation.” The Rs1,000 crore include facilities like scholarships and assistance for buying land. Ram Hari Roopkunwar, a Dhangar leader from Congress in Sholapur, said, “BJP has only exploited the community for votes.” He said will he put up a proposal in a forthcoming meeting of various community leaders and a mass agitation will be launched. Ramrao Wadkute of NCP in Hingoli said that the Dhangars have been left disillusioned. “It is just an allocation. The final implementation will take its own time. I will be taking up the issue with the party leadership and woo the community to launch a struggle. The Dhangar leaders are ready with all the resources,” he said. HC asks judge to verify all safety measu.description: NAGPUR: Continuing its tough stand on lack of facilities in District and Sessions Court complex here, the Nagpur bench of Bombay High Court on Wednesday directed the principal district judge (PDJ) to verify all compliances as claimed by the state public works department (PWD) and submit a report in 20 days. A division bench comprising justices Ravi Deshpande and Vinay Joshi was hearing an application moved by lawyer Manoj Sable where he pointed out lack of facilities in the lower court premises due to which three women lawyers were stuck up in one of the lifts and needed to be admitted in the ICU after being suffocated on June 11. The application was filed in PIL (No 67/2015) by Sable through counsel Shreerang Bhandarkar praying for directives to the PWD for construction of additional infrastructure like courts and bar rooms for convenience of lawyers and litigants. Firdos Mirza appeared for high court, while Uday Dable pleaded for District Bar Association (DBA). Earlier, the judges added ThyssenKrupp Elevators, which was having annual maintenance contract (AMC) for the lifts in entire District and Sessions’ Court complex, as a respondent in the case, following its failure to do servicing of lifts that led to last week’s accident. In its affidavit, the PWD executive engineer (electrical division) Manish Patil informed that generator set for providing backup for lifts was purchased way back in 1968 and has now become outdated. The work order to purchase a 500 KVADG set of generator is given to the agency to assist 100% power backup. He sought 40 days to replace it with new one. However, the judges turned down his request, asking him to complete the formalities within 20 days. Patil also referred to some of the points raised by PDJ Vibha Ingle in her affidavit to the court where she had pointed out non-compliance of 16 electrical works by the PWD. He informed that most of the works were completed in this regard. In last hearing, the bench had directed respondents to ensure sufficient measures for fire safety in the building, to avoid any eventuality. To this, the PWD informed that for fire safety measures, an estimate was technically sanctioned by the department and its tender was floated on June 11. Its tender bid would open on July 5. The administrative approval for installing new fire fighting system was received on June 12. Patil came out with startling revelation that the work on providing firefighting system could be completed within 40 days and later permission from the Nagpur municipal Corporation (NMC) could be obtained. It means, there is no firefighting system in the premises which is thronged by over 20,000 visitors every day, thus putting their lives at a big risk in case of emergency, according to lawyers. (With inputs from Sharvari Lohkare) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

More orange farmers call in with \u2018d.description: NAGPUR: After TOI’s report on dying orange orchards in Amravati and Nagpur districts that appeared on Wednesday, more farmers called in to narrate their woes. Shridhar Solo, from Warud and an ex-ZP member, said that the government was sitting over a proposal of Lakhara Laghu Sinchan Yojna (irrigation project). “Over 30 lakh trees have died. Irrigation secretary (Eknath Dhwale) should be held responsible for this,” he said. City homeopath Dr Gopal Bhutada said that he owned about 3,000 trees near Benoda village in Warud tehsil. “But there are no irrigation facilities to cater to the area’s water needs for the orange crop,” he said. Bhutada added that an irrigation scheme had approval and water would have been available in plenty but “execution of the project has been delayed due to unknown reasons”. Bawanrao Warade, from Mohpa-Mohgaon village in Kalmeshwar tehsil, also called for government action in favour of farmers. Wandu Wasankar, from village Khadsi in Achalpur tehsil in Amravati district, owns a 20-acre orchard with 3,000 orange trees. He told TOI that orchards had dried up in Akot, Chandur Bazar and Anjangaon tehsils too. “The Sapan dam which is nearby is ready and holds water. But the government has not created channels to supply water to farmers,” he said. According to Ravi Patil, who is also from Achalpur tehsil, the Sapan dam has a huge catchment area. “Water could have been brought from Chandrabhaga dam too,” he added. Parag Kadu, of Pardi Deshmukh village in Kamleshwar tehsil, says that though he has managed to keep most of his orchard “alive, 600 trees have dried up”. The situation is worst in Chakdo, Ramgiri and Kahiri villages, according to him. Vasant Chaple, from Lohari Sangi village in Narked tehsil, says that he has lost 900 trees so far. “The ‘Kar water project’ is close by. It still holds 50% water but the government has not left any in the river for irrigation which resulted in the drying up of orchards. At least some trees could have been saved if water would have been released,” he said. Kahapa (Narkhed tehsil) village sarpanch Pramod Bannagre said that the Khapa project water reservoir is pending since 1982. “We met guardian minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule last year. He called a meeting but the micro-irrigation department said that they had lost all documentation. The project is dead,” he said. There is news of fresh estimates being prepared. “If the situation continues like this, the farmers will be forced to move out from here,” said Bannagre. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

SC commission calls for report on boy su.description: WARDHA: The National Commission for Scheduled Castes (NSSC) has asked Wardha collector to file a report on the incident where an 8-year-old boy of Matang community suffered burns on being forced to sit on hot tiles as punishment after entering a temple at Arvi on Saturday. State women and child development minister Pankaja Munde also condemned the incident in Mumbai, and assured action against the accused. At Arvi, the Bhim Tiger Sena (BTS) demanded stringent action against the accused, and handed over a memorandum to district collector and sub-divisional office on Monday. The incident has been condemned by many organizations on social media too. Aryan Khadse, 8, a resident of Rani Laxmibai Ward of Arvi town, was accused of stealing some coins from a temple by accused Umesh alias Amol Dhore. The accused punished Aryan by forcing him to sit on hot tiles on Saturday afternoon, which caused serious burn injuries on his buttocks. Aryan is admitted at Arvi general hospital. On Monday, the state office of the NSSC, at Pune, wrote to the Wardha collector and superintendent of police, asking for a report on the incident. Attaching a printout of the story published in the TOI, the commission has asked for the factual details of the case. The BTS claimed in its memorandum that the incident happened out of hate ‘as victim entered temple’. The boy belongs to Matang community and was punished by Dhore, who belongs to OBC, they said. To stop such incidents in future, BTS demanded stringent action against accused Dhore. However, residents of Rani Laxmibai Ward reiterated on Monday, on condition of anonymity, that the children play in the temple yard every day, and no one has ever raised any objections. A resident said there is no caste discrimination, but the accused sells illicit liquor, and always creates trouble for children. He added, “I think the accused never dreamt of the consequences while punishing the child.” BTS district president Atul Diwe said the boy’s parents have objected to the horrible punishment. “If accused wanted to punish the child, he could have told the parents. He dared to do this because the boy belongs to lower class. Is it possible to do such a thing with any higher caste?” Diwe said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nRaisoni College organises get-together.description: A get-together organised recently by the Raisoni College of Commerce, Science and Technology was high on fun and camaraderie.  The power-packed event had many entertaining acts and interesting games. Divided in different teams, students donned various superhero tees and brought forth their competitive streak in various games like truth or dare and musical chairs. Impromptu colourful dances, singing and humourous skits added entertainment to the do. The Raisonians, being the sport they are, performed all the tasks with great enthusiasm. The youngsters later were spotted clicking selfies and sharing light moments , bonding over refreshments. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Women SHGs to plant bamboo in Koradi pla.description: NAGPUR: Energy minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule has directed Mahagenco to make available land belonging to Koradi Thermal Power Station (KTPS) to women self help groups (SHGs) for bamboo plantation. Accordingly, 75 acre will be handed over on July 1. SR Gajalwar, superintending engineer (civil) of KTPS, said that each SHG would have 20 members. “We will hand over 5 acre to one SHG. As fifteen such groups have been selected, the total area to be brought under bamboo cultivation is 75 acre. This was meant for tree plantation. We are doing both afforestation as well as discharging our social responsibility,” he added. Mahagenco has roped in National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (Neeri) for technical consultation. “Neeri scientists will help the SHG members in planting bamboo and taking care of the plants for three years. After that the members will do the job themselves,” said Gajalwar. According to the official, the ownership of the plantation land will remain with Mahagenco. “We are handing it over to the women just for use. We will not charge any rent,” he said. Mahagenco is yet to decide whether it will keep a share of revenue generated from sale of bamboo. Replying to a query, Gajalwar said, “The SHGs were chosen by senior officials of KTPS.” Mahagenco has lot of open land in KTPS. A mini solar power plant has come up on ash bund of Chandrapur Super Thermal Power Station (CSTPS). However, there are no such plans in Koradi plant. Some of its land has been however, used for the fly-ash cluster. Hearing on Genco’s coal mine on 27thThe public hearing for the Gare Pelma coal mine of Mahagenco in Chhattisgarh will be held on June 27. The mine has been allocated to the generation company for meetings its future coal needs. Mahagenco has appointed Adani as its operator even though all the formalities are yet to be completed. The coal mine is facing strong opposition from locals, whose land is to be acquired. Mahagenco expects trouble from activists and police security has been sought. Earlier, coal ministry had allocated Macchakatta mine in Odisha to Mahagenco but it could not acquire land due to opposition from locals. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Lincoln\u2019s letter\u2019 throws.description: NAGPUR: Several insightful facets of life were thrown open during the Girish Gandhi Foundation-organized seminar on ‘Abraham Lincoln’s letter to the teacher: Today’s Perspective’ at Dhanwate Hall, Shankar Nagar, on Sunday.  The seminar concentrated on the teachings of Lincoln and the implementation of the same then and now. It also debated upon various ways, teachings and ethics taught to students nowadays. Senior journalist Shailesh Pandey, Mubarak Syed and Sandhya Pawar, both teachers were the panellists. Addressing the gathering, teacher Sandhya Pawar said, “ I want my students to be good human beings first. I don’t want to make my students learn, I want to educate them.” On a lighter vein, she said, “I believe if mobile phones were invented back in the time of Lincoln, he surely would have recommended against it.” Journalist Pande explained the topic to the audience and told them what it actually meant. He took the help of historical events like the American Civil War to explain his points as he went deeper into the subject. “The American Civil War was one of the greatest moral, constitutional and economic crisis in the world. Why? Because all men were considered equal except for South American men.” Pandey said, “Lincoln effectively addressed many problems in the world including inequality among men.” Picking up the topic right where Pandey left it, Mubarak Syed, “People often ask me why I chose to become a teacher to which I reply that it was never my choice. My father wanted me to become one.” Terming the role of a teacher as inspirational and motivational, Syed recalled an instance, “I once said to one of my students ‘you just walk forward ... I will be there behind you, supporting and encouraging you always’. That’s the sort of faith a teacher should instill in one’s student.” Rekha Dandige anchored the seminar. She explained the importance of a teacher in a child’s life and compared him to a father. “ Like a father has a very important role in the upbringing of a child, similarly a teacher too plays a vital role in moulding a child’s future,” she said. President of Girish Gandhi Foundation Shrikant Tidke proposed a vote of thanks. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MWRRA slams NMC for using dead stock fro.description: NAGPUR: The Maharashtra Water Resources Regulatory Authority (MWRRA) has reportedly slammed the Water Resources Department (WRD) and Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) for using dead stock of Totladoh reservoir. Advocate Ashish Jaiswal, former Shiv Sena MLA from Ramtek, had brought it to the notice of MWRRA that dead stock is being used without permission since last one month. In a big revelation, Jaiswal said the state government has not issued any written permission to use the dead stock. Jaiswal has filed a contempt petition against WRD, NMC, collector, and two more respondents with MWRRA. A five-member bench of MWRRA chaired by KP Bakshi held a hearing on the petition on Tuesday. In the petition, Jaiswal said using dead stock was a contempt of MWRRA order dated September 12, 2018. “WRD has even allowed NMC to use more water than allocated from Totladoh reservoir. NMC did nothing to bring down losses or develop its own water sources,” he said. Jaiswal told TOI, WRD and NMC committed a crime by using dead stock without permission. “WRD and NMC officials failed to show any permission to MWRRA. It has come at the cost of lakhs of farmers, people, cattle and wildlife. I pleaded for appropriate action against all concerned persons from the five respondent agencies,” he said. On May 14, mayor Nanda Jichkar had met CM Devendra Fadnavis and claimed to have received permission to utilize 30 MMC from dead stock. On the directives of MWRRA, WRD officials said NMC used 163 MMC as against allocation of 154 MMC as on Monday. “Total utilization of water for NMC will be around 170 MMC by June end,” they said. MWRRA reportedly came down heavily on WRD and NMC for using more water than allocated. Jaiswal added NMC misled MWRRA on the quantum of non-revenue water (NRW). “MWRRA asked NMC officials to inform it about current NRW. NMC officials said current NRW was 45%. Actually, NRW of NMC is much more than that. MWRRA passed strictures on NMC officials. NRW of NMC should have been 14% in current condition,” he said. Jaiswal also brought it to the notice of MWRRA that NMC has failed to bring down high consumption. He said NMC was drawing and supplying much more water than norms and requirement. In the petition, Jaiswal said the respondents did not comply with one of the directives of MWRRA. “NMC has not complied with direction passed by this authority by not carrying out the accrued assessment of groundwater potential with the help of Groundwater Survey and Development Agency, Pune, and Central Groundwater Board office at Nagpur. It has also not planned augmentation of water supply with groundwater, storm water as well as ponds/ reservoirs/ tanks available within Nagpur city area,” he said. Farmers\u2019 body gears up for sowing o.description: NAGPUR: Farmers’ organization Shetkari Sangathana has printed declaration forms on which it plans to get signatures of peasants across the state for planting illegal genetically modified variety of herbicide tolerant (HT) seeds in their fields. In what it calls to be a civil disobedience movement of its kind, the Sangathana has been pressing for free access to technology in agriculture including mass use of GM seeds. The HT seeds that have been developed by American biotech giant Monsanto are resistant to herbicides (weed killers), which have glyphosate as a key ingredient. Even the glyphosate-based herbicide has been developed by Monsanto. Shetkari Sangathana has been demanding that the government should allow use of HT seeds, as it will help them save a major cost on removal of weeds by deploying manual labour. However, experts say even if the seeds are allowed, cotton farmers may not be able to use HT variety legally. Former director of Central Institute of Cotton Research (CICR) Keshav Kranthi said that this is because glyphosate-based herbicide are only recommended for use in teal plantations and barren land. Without being allowed to use glyphosate, HT seeds not be of any use to the cotton grower. Kranthi now heads the technical section of International Cotton Advisory Council in the US. In its comment to an earlier report carried by TOI, even Monsanto had said, “In India, glyphosate-based herbicides have been recommended for use in general weed control in non-cropped areas such as tea and pre-plant rice. It should be used only as per the recommended guidelines.” Anil Ghanawat, President of Shetkari Sangathana, however said that glyphosate is non-selective herbicide and can also be used on the cotton crop. Shetkari Sangathana had started its campaign last week from Akoli Jahangir village of Akola district where farmer Lalit Bahale planted the seeds in front of police and 1,200 other farmers. If proven, this can lead to a five-year sentence. After that, farmers in districts like Wardha, Dhule and Ahmednagar have planted the seeds. This would be followed by farmers in Parbhani and Amravati. The declaration form prepared by the Sangathana will have details like farmers’ name, village and the area in which the seed has been planted. Shetkari Sangathana has been pressing that the government should allow use of HT seeds. However, after the trials, Monsanto itself had withdrawn its application in 2016. On this, Ghanawat said it was due to the low royalty it would have got on the seeds. “The Sangathana demands that the government should not intervene in the prices and give the technology provider a free hand letting the market decide the price,” he said. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

28-year-old man alleges torture, intimid.description: NAGPUR: Rahul Kubde, 28, has alleged torture and intimidation by cops posted at Imambada police station on June 10. The Siraspeth resident also claimed that a police sub-inspector (PSI) and a few constables made him sit among criminals for more than five hours without registering any case against him. On his complaint to senior police officers, Zonal DCP Raj Tilak Roushan ordered an inquiry. “ACP from Sakkardara is investigating the matter. If a police personnel is involved, action will be taken against him.” It is learnt that Kubde, who works at a petrol pump near Dorli village, was having a dispute with his wife and the duo was being counselled at the police department’s Bharosa cell. His wife was residing with her parents since 1 1/2 years. The couple married two years ago and has an 8-month-old child. On June 9, Kubde claimed that he received a call from one Jadhav, apparently a policeman, who wanted to visit him. On the next day, when Kubde reached his parent’s house he was surprise to find the door locked. Soon, Kubde’s wife, her family members and two constables from Immambada police station too landed up there. “The cops asked me to break the lock and allow my wife to enter the house, but I couldn’t do it. Then they asked me come to the police station,” said Kubde. At Imambada police station, Kubde claimed that he was abused by cops which included PSI Patwadkar. “The cops got angry and without reason started slapping me. They took me inside the lock-up and thrashed me with a ‘bajirao’ belt. There was no offence registered against me, still the cops tortured me and made me sit with criminals from 1.30am to 4.45pm,” said Kubde. Kubde was also threatened with a “fake case complaint”. “I was told I would be in jail for six months without getting any bail,” he said. According to Kubde, the police took action as his wife’s uncle is a cop. Senior PI of Imambada police station MM Salunkhe said, “We had received a complaint from Kubde’s wife that he was not letting her inside the house. My officer had scolded him on that.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur water crisis set to aggravate as.description: NAGPUR: Water crisis in the city as well as for irrigation in the district is likely to increase compared to this year as Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) will be unable to utilize running water of Kanhan river. The huge saving of water in Pench reservoirs will not be possible as the water resources department (WRD) is all set to miss the deadline for completing Kochchhi barrage on Kanhan river by December-end. The NMC standing committee on Tuesday approved the water works department’s proposal to appoint WAPCOS Limited, a central government company, to prepare Detailed Project Report (DPR) and also execute the project to use running water of Kanhan river instead of water from Pench reservoirs for six months, from June to December. The civic body will pay WAPCOS Rs21.99 crore for the project. NMC uses water from Pench reservoirs to supply drinking water to 70% areas of the city throughout the year. Requirement of remaining water is met from running water of Kanhan river. During summer, Kanhan river has to be fed from Pench reservoirs. Huge quantum of water goes waste from Kanhan river between June and December due to lack of a reservoir on it. Therefore, NMC planned to lay a pipeline from Kanhan river and use this running water instead of water from Pench reservoirs in these six months. The plan approved on Tuesday will take at least one year for WAPCOS Limited to prepare DPR and complete the project. The plan was prepared in June last year but was delayed due to reasons known only to NMC officials. Due to shortage of water in Pench reservoirs, WRD could not supply water for irrigation during both, kharip and rabbi, seasons. NMC is drawing water from dead stock of Pench reservoirs for last one month. The Pench reservoirs are likely to get less water this year too due to construction of Chaurai dam by Madhya Pradesh upstream of Pench river. Therefore, the delay in mitigation measures is likely to increase the water crisis next year. Ruling party leader Sandip Joshi admitted the inordinate delay from the water works department in completing the process. “We have decided to award the work to WAPCOS Limited without going for tendering process due to the delay. The project would have been delayed further in case of tendering,” he said. Standing committee chairman Pradip Pohane said he would check about the delay and take appropriate action. In another setback, WRD officials confirmed water cannot be stored in Kochchhi barrage this monsoon. “Some 80% of the works are completed. Project require another Rs300 crore for completion. We will be able to store water only in the next monsoon,” they said. The barrage costing Rs947 crore is the first on Kanhan river. Around 75 million meter cube (MMC) water could have been stored in the barrage if it had been completed in time. The project was delayed due to shortage of funds. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Nurture your creativity, give wings to i.description: The scope of animation runs across all domains of the entertainment industry. With the competition in this industry getting fiercer every day, the future of animation is huge and promising. Other than being an art of drawing cartoons, animation and multimedia have emerged as an industry with tremendous revenues. The excessive use of special effects has helped animation get a hold over movies, television and advertising sectors. It is one of the most concrete, lucrative and demanding career options which serves both entertainment and education industries alike. Those in this profession create animation and visual effects for films, video games, television, mobile devices, and other forms of media using illustrations and software programmes. Animators also create graphics and develop storyboards, drawings and illustrations. They create, plan, and script animated narrative sequences, and assist with background design as well as production coordination. If you are looking to enter this profession, the possible roadmap is to enroll into degree programmes or certificate courses offering exhaustive understanding of animation, graphics & web designing and multimedia. It is advised to build a portfolio in order to showcase artistry and creative and technical skills. Gaining work experience and maintaining your proficiency is of utmost importance. Ashita Reuben, co-founder and creative head of Coffee Beans Studio, said the best part about the job is feeling satisfied at the end of the day and receiving praise from clients. She said, “The animation industry in India is expected to grow at a pace faster than any other industry. As a career option, it is a field where you can fulfil your dream of having fun as you work.” The skills required to foray into this field include nurturing creativity and appreciation of aesthetics. An animator must have the ability to express ideas through drawings. This demands a good visual imagination along with appropriate sense of colour. Being able to use computerols to generate visuals, while utilizing knowledge of mathematics and physics is invaluably helpful in all aspects of this industry. You can constantly hone your craft by engaging with different projects. You should also be able to constantly update yourself with dynamic technologies. Work opportunities for quality animators and related professionals like graphic designer, multimedia and game developer, character designer, key frame animator, 3D modeler and layout artist exist in sectors of advertising, online and print news media, film and television, cartoon production, theater, video gaming and e-learning at large. This booming industry houses opportunities with government as well as private sectors. It has an open field of employment opportunities in animation studios as story board artists, animation or character artists, compositing artists, video and audio specialists, visualizing, texture and lighting artists and editors in film labs. XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX Why opt for the subject High demand for animators Interesting work environment Work in a range of industries, from gaming to film animation Constant engagement of your imagination XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX Expert View Venu Dindi An industry full of creative people For a career path in animation, gaming, VFX or motion graphics, you need to be highly creative with a logical thinking cap. This challenging career allows you to work on a wide range of projects in various industries. To be successful you must be creative, detail-oriented, patient, and have the ability to see the product you are creating even before it gets put to paper or computer screen. If you enjoy being creative, can work independently, and enjoy bringing characters to life, animation may be a career choice worth considering. All the way, you are expected to be creative and artistic, with communication and time management skills. You must have computer expertise and the ability to use animation and video editing skills. Jobs related to your degree in animation include character modeller, rigging artist, animator, texture artist, games developer, graphic designer, illustrator, VFX artist, web designer Etc. Animation is a great way to make a living. It’s an industry full of creative people who get excited about what they do. Starting out, expect to put in long hours to hone your skills. Be prepared to move around a bit to go where there’s work. Be respectful of those you work with and you’ll find many artists who are more than happy to share their knowledge and experience. The future for 3D animators as a career is wide and varied. It encompasses a wide range of industries, from working at a production studio, to small animation companies, to ad agencies, to video game manufacturers to enjoying job works as an independent freelancer. Design companies rely on logos and corporate animations. You’d be amazed at how many television commercials and logos are 3D creations. Animation is opening in as many sectors you can think. You could also work at advertising agencies, design companies, animated television series, film doing background scene or creating animation web-series for YouTube or ad-series for social media. A few brave souls even decide to go it alone and make their own films. Most employers prefer to hire candidates who have a bachelor’s degree or diploma in animation, computer graphics, fine arts, or a related discipline. Choosing a mentor with strong industry exposure is most important rather than just joining institutes with glossy makeups, theoretical classes, costly branding, interiors or happening environments. In the 25 years or so that I have been involved in animation, I have worked with over a dozen different studios ranging from 5 to 250 in staff. The one constant in all these studios is the human dynamism. All studios are successful because of the talent they collect. No matter what your role is, you should always be aware of those around you and learn from their collective experience. Animation, gaming and VFX is a collaborative process and everyone working on a project adds value. Respect others but don’t be afraid to make your job count. If everyone does that, then you get a synergy that is impossible to describe. (Dindi is founder director of Dindiwood Media Entertainment Pvt Ltd) XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX List of colleges Arena Animation, Nagpur Courses offered: Broadcast editing, 3D modelling with max, advance 3D animation (for more info, contact institute) Duration: 5 months for broadcast editing, 4 months for 3D modelling with max Admission procedure: Direct admission after Std X and XII Source: Admission desk Toon One, Nagpur Courses offered: BSc in multimedia and animation, diploma in animation Duration: 3 years for BSc and 1.5 years for diploma Admission procedure: Direct Source: Institute website MAAC, Nagpur Courses offered: 3D animation and film making (For more courses, contact institute) Duration: 2 years Admission procedure: Direct Source: Nital Sawde, centre head This list is not exhaustive and should not be considered as the endorsement of the institute. Students are advised to check with relevant education authorities before taking admission XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX PROFESSIONALS SPEAK If you want to study animation, you must have broad and clear thinking. One must be creative with whatever they do. They must have a vision in their minds which is unique and stands out among others Mudit Bhatnagar I chose this field because as an artist, I felt animation and film design would let me explore a lot of things. With evolving industries, I also get a chance to evolve, learn, try something new rather than just using pencil and paper Shubham Banerjee People should be aware of their interests and abilities. Hard work and dedication are required everywhere if you seek success. If you keep in mind your abilities and passions, this field can be fun and interesting. It will help evolve your creative thinking Himangi Sharma Try to fit in with diverse people and not fall in love with your own creations too much. Asking questions about how to perform a particular task rather than just sitting there mindlessly would be the advice I’d like to give upcoming artists Selvyn Quiney Animation is a very vast industry. It consists of so many various fields and is also expanding rapidly. Anyone from any field can join in animation. There are no regulations. It consists of around 32 to 50 career options Abhishek Suresh Acharya (Compiled by Manshika Vaikkath) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

All Nagpur buses to run on CNG by fiscal.description: NAGPUR: In a move that will put a major check on air pollution in city, transport department of Nagpur Municipal Corporation is to convert all 431 city buses from diesel-run to CNG-run. It will also induct five electric buses in 2019-20. Jitendra Kukde, chairman of NMC’s transport committee, mentioned this in his budget of Rs277.84 crore for 2019-20 presented before the standing committee chairman Pradip Pohane. The expected expenditure of the department will be Rs 278.41 crore. Now, Pohane will include transport panel’s budget in his budget to be presented in the general body. Kukde has projected a revenue of Rs 90 crore from sale of tickets while remaining Rs 188.41 crore funding from standing committee. The panel chief said the department will earn Rs 25 lakh from bus shelters advertisements. Following the vision of Union transport minister Nitin Gadkari to promote ecofriendly public transport, Kukde has proposed to convert all 235 standard buses, 150 midi and 45 mini buses to run on CNG. Already the civic body had converted one bus to run on CNG, he said. Kukde also announced migration of all NMC’s owned four-wheelers, including mayor’s car, to CNG. “By end of this financial year, entire Aapli Bus fleet will run on CNG,” Kukde claimed. About strengthening Aapli Bus service in congested areas like Itwari, Mahal, Mominpura, Kukde said operation of mini-buses will start by next month. Already, 15 buses have arrived and remaining 30 will join the Aapli bus fleet soon. “Even MahaMetro has approached the civic body for starting feeder bus service from its stations. We will provide mini-buses for the purpose,” he said. He announced provision of free travel for specially-abled persons and women kin of martyrs. He said civic body will bear the expenditure for martyrs’ kin under ‘Mi Jijao Mata scheme,’ while state’s social welfare department will fund specially-abled persons’ travel. Kukde has proposed to provide common mobility card that could be used both on Metro as well as Aapli Buses. He also proposed to set up water ATMs near major bus shelters and earmarked Rs 2 crore for the purpose. Already the service has been introduced at a bus shelter near KDK College and is getting good response, he claimed. He also proposed to introduce the facility to buy tickets for Aapli Bus on mobile phones. For this, NMC is tying up with a private operator Chalo App. Using this app, commuters can also locate the bus and see timetable, eliminating need to wait. About state government’s economic survey that shows NMC had earned Rs 84 lakh profit from city bus operation in last financial year, Kukde and transport manager Shivajirao Jagtap said NMC had suffered Rs 76.5 crore loss. Couple robbed at knifepoint.description: NAGPUR: Four unidentified youngsters aged between 20 and 22 years robbed a couple at knifepoint near Ambazari T-point on Monday, fleeing with valuables worth Rs17,000, including cash Rs5,000. The robbers also decamped with a mobile phone from the couple. Rakesh Sasane, 22, and his woman friend were enjoying a ride around Ambazari Lake on their two-wheeler when they were intercepted near the T-point by the armed youngsters. After compelling the couple to part with their valuables, the youngsters fled the spot. Sasane, working as an attorney, approached Ambazari police station and registered a complaint of robbery. Chainsukh Sancheti takes over as VDB cha.description: NAGPUR: Chainsukh Sancheti, a five-term MLA of the Bharatiya Janata Party from Malkapur constituency in Buldhana district has finally assumed the charge of chairman of the Vidarbha Development Board (VDB). His appointment was initially announced in June last year. One of the senior-most BJP MLAs, he has been getting elected continuously since 1995 from Buldhana district. A very loyal worker of the party, his family has strong roots in the RSS. Sancheti till recently stayed away from power. He was appointed on June 11 last year as the development board chairman. But Sancheti was apparently not that keen on the post and instead sought a ministerial berth though the board chairman’s post has cabinet minister status. Now with his 5th term coming to an end in a few months, he accepted the post just after he could not make it to the cabinet in a reshuffle on Sunday by chief minister Devendra Fadnavis. On Monday, in the presence of VDB member Dr Kapil Chandrayan, board deputy director Prakash Dayre and staff he took charge and expressed his commitment to give a boost to the VDB work by pursuing pending issues with the governor who is the statutory head of the board. An MSc in chemistry, Sancheti also dabbled in the construction business before starting his political career as municipal council member and then MLA for five terms from Malkapur. In college days he was a keen wrestler. He is the uncle of influential ex-MP Ajay Sancheti. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

VTA for January-December final year in B.description: NAGPUR: Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman had asked inputs from citizens on the Union Budget 2019-20 with a view to make the Budget making exercise more participative and inclusive. Accordingly Vidarbha Taxpayers Association (VTA) called a general body meeting which was presided by JP Sharma to discuss and send suggestions to the finance ministry. President of VTA JP Sharma suggested that it is high time that central government brings in Direct Tax Code (DTC), wherein the accounting year should be rescheduled to January to December so that we match the universal pattern of accounting. Secretary Tejinder Singh Renu submitted that VTA has been constantly writing to finance ministry that threshold limit of direct tax should be raised from existing Rs2.5 lakh to Rs5 lakh in DTC; likewise the tax slabs should also be 10% for Rs5 lakh to Rs10 lakh salary, 20% for Rs10 lakh to Rs20 lakh and 30% above Rs20 lakh. More accountability on assessing officers should be introduced so that sense of responsibility is there on both the sides. Vice-president Shrawankumar Malu suggested that bank lending and its procedure has been too much rigid whereby even genuine borrowers, business houses and industries are facing tough times to manage financial deals. Hence it’s highly recommended that finance ministry relaxes banking procedure to its realistic position wherein financial institutions as well as business can grow steadily. Likewise more liberty should be given to bank heads in same city itself so that file data transfer and delay is eliminated. Industrialist Surendrakumar Jaiswal suggested that threshold limit of Micro Small and Medium Enterprise (MSME) should be increased from Rs10 crore to Rs50 crore. Furthermore definition of MSME of Centre and State varies which creates too many complex situations. Hence they should be common for factual growth of this sector. Saqib Parekh suggested that terminology of assessment year (AY) should be totally eliminated in DTC as this FY and AY creates too much of confusion for common man and with January to December financial year the year mention would also be single, which will bring much needed clarity. VTA members present in the meeting were treasurer Pawan Chopra, joint secretaries Hemant Trivedi and Amarjeet Singh Chawla, executive body members Ashvin Agrawal, CA Hemant Sarda, Govind Patel, Veeru Balani, Rahul Agrawal, Narendrapal Singh Osan, Pankaj Roshan, Harmanjeet Singh Baweja, Pratish Gujrathi and others. NMC may lose 163 marks for potholes in S.description: NAGPUR: The next round of Swachh Survekshan is likely to see Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) lose marks due to potholes on roads. NMC has received a kit for the 2020 Swachh Bharat Survekshan, which has three broad parameters; infrastructure availability, maintenance of road premises and equipment, and feedback from commuters for rating roads on overall cleanliness, under the Swachh Bharat Survey. Bad roads or potholed roads would cost NMC 163 marks. In 2019, Nagpur city stood 58th in the Swachh survey. This means NMC will not only have to make the roads free of potholes but also keep them well maintained through the monsoon. Even open water drainage system will account for four marks. Lack of zebra crossings or stop lines will cost the civic body another four marks. Non-functioning or poor maintenance of traffic signals will also cost four marks. Encroachment on footpaths and lack of traffic signs weighs for eight marks. In recent years, NMC earned a dubious distinction for bad roads and poor maintenance of traffic signals. Civic activist and secretary of Vidarbha Taxpayers Association (VTA) Tejinder Singh Renu admitted that Nagpur will face an extreme challenge due to new parameters of Swachh infrastructure. “As a majority of roads in Nagpur are under construction, our current roads condition, water drainage, street markings and cleanliness is certainly not up to the mark. Therefore, maintaining our position will be a big challenge for city administration,” he pointed out. “I believe such change of parameters by ministry of urban development is deliberate so that all city administrations concentrate on road conditions, which need to be good with the monsoon around the corner. Bad roads in the rainy season makes road usage extremely dangerous, especially for two-wheeler users,” he added. Our city administration needs to be strict about contractors, including those of MSRDC, NHAI and NIT, as roads are not repaired even after other work is completed. The service roads are in a pathetic condition, which makes riding absolutely miserable during monsoon. “If roads are not made motorable soon, I fear a drastic drop in city’s rating in next Swachh Bharat rankings,” he said. Another challenge for NMC this year will be to remain on its toes through the year, as from this year Swachh Bharat assessment would be undertaken on a quarterly basis. This move comes after many cities slipped, and were not able to maintain hygiene once they got a decent ranking on cleanliness levels in the previous Swachh surveys, and NMC was no exception. The quarterly rank of cities will play a crucial role in their annual ranking in Swachh Survekshan 2020 because of the 25% weight given to the quarterly assessment, said the official. The annual assessment will be conducted between January and February 2020, he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Foreign docs of Indian origin keen to te.description: NAGPUR: Doctors of Indian origin in foreign countries have shown interest in coming back to India and work as faculty in the newly opened medical colleges. Dr Ramesh Mehta, president of Global Association of Physicians of Indian Origin (GAPIO), was in Nagpur on Monday. He told TOI his organization had submitted a proposal to NITI Ayog that 10,000 doctors based in UK who will retire in next two-three years were willing to join medical colleges as faculty. Mehta said the proposal was welcomed by NITI Ayog and the Indian officials were very positive about it. “I belong to the UK unit of GAPIO, known as British Association of Physicians of Indian Origin. We have 65,000 members. In next two years, 10,000 of these will be retiring and they are willing to work in India,” said Dr Mehta. According to him, the acute shortage of medical faculty in India could be addressed if these doctors are allowed to work. “NITI Ayog officials agreed to provide necessary amenities, documentation and salary as per international standards to them. All of them are Indians by origin. They are willing to work for the nation,” Dr Mehta added. He also revealed another plan of GAPIO to mentor fresh MBBS graduates for four years after their degree. “Due to very limited number of post-graduation (MD/MS) seats in India, fresh MBBS graduates face many problems. We have submitted a plan to train fresh MBBS graduates for two years in India followed by two years in UK. This will be on-the-job training and doctors will get salaries as per British standards during their stay in UK,” said Dr Mehta. He made it clear the plan was not intended to drive brain drain. “After two years of training in UK, candidates will return to India and they have to serve here for a significant time. They will be trained under clinical knowledge development program (CKDP) which is popular module of GAPIO,” Mehta added. NITI Ayog’s vision document ‘Strategy for New India @75’ states an active search strategy, or visiting/adjunct faculty system from India and abroad, and any other methods will be used to deal with faculty shortages in new medical institutes. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi.
